page.lettertext:
fol.211r
Belgia 1591 3 Septem
b
Belgia: 1591: Au
g
Good M
r
Bodlye, I have receyved a l
re
from the
States
wherin they Complayne, that hir
Ma
t
Companies in theis Countries
imployed in Forrayne service, have bene
vided w
th
victuall
at the
greate Charge of the Countrie. This riseth upon
S
r
Henrie
Norreis
Company goinge for
Brytaigne,
and
Captayne Pentons
company latlye imployed into
Normandye.
S
r
Henry Norries
Company went from hence for
Vlushinge
to the other Companies
there attendinge the same jornye, w
ch
accordinge to hir Ma
t
l
er
s (not otherwyse) I Caused to be necessarrylie acco
m
odated.
The Towne here supplyeinge ther want
for victuell
, to be
resatisfied by
S
r
John Norreis
Officers at Vlushinge, at
the Companyes arryvall there, as I knowe order was lefte,
and tyll the receyte of this l
er
e I knewe not bu
t
satysfaction
had bene made; wherof the States knowe howe to satysfye
themselves at S
r
John Norreis hand
and in
e meane time they may c
o
tent these [burgers]
As for the Charge
the [.]
my hand, w
ch
I here they have
p
r
sented to the States as touchinge theis Charges, I gave
them, therby to receyve their satysfactione, up
o
n the aryvall
of the Company at Vlushinge, at the hand
of S
r
John
Norreis officers there appoynted for the same purpose.
As for the Charge they were at w
th
Captayne Pentons
Companye, I gave noe such directione to Charge the
Towne w
th
the victuellinge of them, but loked
S
r
Thomas
Sherleyes
deputye
here should have done yt, whome I
have nowe Cause d to resatysfye the Towne. Therfor
I beseach yowe accquaynte the States w
th
this my aunswere
herein, w
ch
I hope will satysfye them.
And so with my most
hartye Commendations I Leave yowe to God. Breill
this iij
th
of September
1591
.
Yo
r
frend to co
m
aund Thomas Burgh.
